samples.context: If someone gets enough sleep, they tend to have more energy during the day. Sam does not have more energy during the day.
samples.question: Does Sam get enough sleep?

samples.context: When someone eats lots of fruits and vegetables, they usually have a healthy diet. Tom does not have a healthy diet.
samples.question: Does Tom eat lots of fruits and vegetables?

samples.context: If someone practices a musical instrument regularly, they will likely become skilled at playing it. Emily has not become skilled at playing the piano.
samples.question: Does Emily practice the piano regularly?

samples.context: When someone takes good notes during class, they are able to study more effectively later. Alex is not able to study effectively later.
samples.question: Does Alex take good notes during class?

samples.context: If someone trains consistently for a marathon, they can usually complete the full distance. James was not able to complete the full marathon distance.
samples.question: Did James train consistently for the marathon?

samples.context: When someone gets enough sleep, they are typically able to focus better during the day. John is unable to focus well during the day.
samples.question: Does John get enough sleep?

samples.context: If someone has good time management skills, they can often accomplish more in less time. Amy does not accomplish more in less time.
samples.question: Does Amy have good time management skills?

samples.context: People who eat a balanced diet tend to have more energy. Sam does not have more energy.
samples.question: Does Sam eat a balanced diet?

samples.context: When someone practices good hygiene, they are less likely to get sick. Sarah is not less likely to get sick.
samples.question: Does Sarah practice good hygiene?

samples.context: If someone studies hard, they usually get good grades. Tom does not get good grades.
samples.question: Does Tom study hard?
